result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent James Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Sign up for probation no later than 10/18/22.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Petro Mart or Mak.

No firearms or dangerous weapons.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/18/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent James Ramos

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent James Ramos in court.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas in court for Vincent James Ramos.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 6 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/18/22.
- No contact with Petro Mart or MAK.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/18/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
on behalf of the defendant, filed.  rmm
on behalf of the defendant, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm
on behalf of the defendant, filed.  rmm
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Defendant Vincent James Ramos in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  
Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Vargas requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Vincent James Ramos in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Vargas has not had contact with his client and has not been able to discuss the case.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Vincent James Ramos in court.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Ronnie Vargas as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Vargas accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 7/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact order signed and filed.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Petro Mart or MAK

Defendant Vincent James Ramos in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Vincent James Ramos in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Vincent James Ramos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
